author: gcolvin
content:
Some of us drift in and out of being active, others seem to have wandered off forever. <@!425279588009246720>  has been more active than not.  I'm taking a break after seeming to be the only active editor for a while.  It also may not be clear whether editors should merge their own drafts.  It's fine by me, not sure how Axic feels.

On editing versus reviewing - I've appreciated your uncompromising reviews, Micah, and have been uncompromising in some of mine.  But as I recall it you've also stood back and said that you would not block merging so long as formal requirements are met, but asked that someone else do it.  I think that might be the appropriate approach.

author: sky.cactus
content: That strategy is effectively a block at the moment.

author: gcolvin
content: We need more active editors.

author: gcolvin
content: But we've know that for a long time.

author: gcolvin
content: Also - if I'm needed just ping me.

author: timbeiko
content: If anyone is lurking here and would like to become one, please make yourself known and we can make it happen ðŸ˜„

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: I would love to be an editor (though I don't feel I've been in the R&D community for long enough to justify).

author: timbeiko
content: <@339771292884664320> my phone is about to die, but I will DM you tomorrow to chat! We should be able to find a way to onboard you ðŸ˜„

author: gcolvin
content: One way people can help is just reviewing EIPs.  I don't think you need to have merge privileges for that.

author: lightclient
content: <@!104006934562107392> <@!301186049323958275> what's the latest on the merge bot? It seems like it has been quite a while now that it's been in the integration stage.

author: lightclient
content: also, btw unfortunately first time contributors' PRs to do not automatically trigger github actions

author: lightclient
content: i believe this was changed after the merge bot work started, but is pretty unfortunate

author: alita85
content: This doesn't allow actions from the user's forked repository to run on a PR without permission. But the actions that are run are actually on the target repository so this shouldn't be an issue

author: alita85
content:
as I understand it we need to
1) get a token for a non-me account
2) turn on merge

author: alita85
content: In general, <@!301186049323958275> if you're comfortable with it I can enable auto-merging

author: lightclient
content: is there anything blocking 1)?

author: timbeiko
content:
As per the last EIPIP call, I've opened a PR to copy the Hard Fork Meta EIPs from the eips repo to the eth1-specs repo: https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/pull/52 

We can discuss on the call tomorrow, but I wanted to share here before merging.
